Division of Cardiovascular Medicine University of Oxford
John Radcliffe Hospital
Headington, Oxford, OX3 9DU

Dr. Alison Kay – Researcher alison.kay@cardiov.ox.ac.uk
Dr. Liz Ormondroyd – Primary investigator liz.ormondroyd@cardiov.ox.ac.uk

Prof. Hugh Watkins – Lead investigator, CureHeart
Prof. Christine Seidman – Co-lead investigator, CureHeart

STUDY PARTICIPANTS NEEDED

Are you affected by cardiomyopathy?

CureHeart is developing genetic therapies to treat inherited cardiomyopathy. https://cureheart.org/patients

The CureHeart: Patient Perspectives study is a vital part of this project and aims to understand how cardiomyopathy impacts peoples' lives, and what people think about current and future treatment.[Ethics Reference:R89137/RE001]

We are looking for people who:

• have cardiomyopathy (any type), or have a relative with cardiomyopathy

• are aged 16 or over

Please visit web link to complete a short online questionnaire (5-10 minutes).

https://app.onlinesurveys.jisc.ac.uk/s/oxford/cureheart-patient-perspectives-study

 

Recruitment advert (CureHeart) V1.0
